intro: Papaver argemone var. plenum, commonly known as the full-flowered argemone, is a variant of the argemone poppy native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its showy, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lobed, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers consist of a central cluster of stamens surrounded by a cup-like structure, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used historically in traditional medicine.
